Happy Listening, Parawhores!

review_title: This is Paramore reborn in the best absolute way
review_text: Im a hardcore day 1 fan. This is Paramore reborn in the best absolute way.
I just got into this group with this album and think it is fantastic.  I heard the other albums and although they are good I think this one is the most consistent for me.

BLECH! What else can I add to the repertoire of bashings that not only this album, but any other album of lackluster emo garbage that has not been said before? This album, like the rest of the piles of excrement this pack of hacks known as Paramore have put out, is nothing but more of the same, dumbed-down, generic cookie-cutter fluff that everyone has heard hundreds of times before, except with a very lame, and failed attempt at a more progressive sound, hence some of the longer song lengths. Please, as if these hacks could ever reach the musical level of bands that have a superior level of talent and complexity, such as Within Temptation, Dream Theater, Sirenia, Arven, or even Delain for that matter? Yeah... when pigs fly! Paramore are NOT a rock band. They are a pop band with distortion. Enough said.

review_title: I wear my sunglasses at night...
review_text: I'm going to keep this short and sweet. I've loved Paramore since 2006, but I liked them because they were pop-punk. So consider this review maybe a little biased. I hate the current trends in music. It's this weird hybrid breed of alt-rock and dance tracks. Fun., The Naked and Famous, etc. That's exactly what this album is. Not too much pop-punk, but more so this sickly sweet feminine (Cardigans-esque) 80's pop. Just a bit more modern.I'm personally not a fan, but I don't acclimate well to musical change. All I know is that this 1980's bubblegum, dance-pop on crack isn't my thing.Favorite tracks:Still Into YouAnklebitersFutureProof
I am very pleased with this purchase. I love paramore and listen to all their other music and this CD was just as good. I would recommend this CD to paramore fans.

I've not been a big Paramore fan, in the past, but since Haley Williams' guest appearance on B.O.B's hit song "Airplanes"; I've been 100% hooked on her voice. So here I am. I've had a listen to this ALBUM and it's sheer genius. They've managed to fit some pop, ska, punk-rock and hard rock ALL together [nicely] into one awesome package. It's a GREAT ALBUM!. Plus Haley's VOICE just can't be denied.
Since I first heard Paramore, almost 7 years ago, I have loved them. This album is awesome - an evolution from what they have done previously but so fun to listen to!

Like I said..I wasn't impressed even a little bit by this CD. Most of the songs on this CD are very folkish in sound. I'm sorry if I wanted folk music I would have bought a folk CD.For this CD they drastically changed their sound...and not, in my opinion, for the better. I understand they lost 2 members, but seriously? Why would you change your style and sound so much in just one album? I know some artist want to branch out and see what they can do, but geez ease into it. This whole album jumped around, nothing makes sense and leaves you asking your self "WTF?"I loved all CD's by Para, so this CD was a great big fat let down. If I could I would return it...
Paramore has a new sound and it doesn't sound good at all. I love the melodies to each song but I hate the words.

While I really liked Paramore's first 3 albums, this one really takes them to a new level. On previous albums there were usually a handful of songs that showed flashes of brilliance, while others were easily passed off as filler. Brand New Eyes was the most consistent out of the bunch but still lacked the ambitious spark I always thought they were capable of. A big chunk of their fan base felt like the departure of the Farro brothers was going to be a huge detriment to the group when in reality, it was probably the best thing to ever happen to them.This album is full of diversity and exploration that never existed in the world of Paramore during their first six years as a group. A lot of this might be due to just how young they were when they formed/had big success. They needed time to come into their own, and that along with the big changes they have gone through in recent years has allowed them to grow into an undeniable powerhouse of a band. Elements of Electronica, R&B, Pop, Punk and Folk all flow throughout this record. Hayley Williams and Taylor York have formed a songwriting partnership that could be incredibly good for years to come.Key Tracks:NowAin't It FunDaydreamingAnklebitersHate To See Your Heart BreakGrow UpFast In My CarStill Into YouFuture

They sound like every other pop group on the radio now. The single Hard Times is the best on the album and the least pop-sounding track but definitely light weight compared to the rest of their catalogue of songs. Very disappointing...we're going to see them live next month and knowing this is the new direction of the band, I'm not even looking forward to it.
I've been a fan of Paramore because Hailey Williams.
My first Paramore purchase and I am not disappointed!  Good slow and hard stuff here.  Likely I will get some of their past work now.
This record is a little different from previous but the writing and vocals are still great! Paramore is still putting great effort into their very catchy songs
This is my favorite album of the year (so far).Just like always, their songs are full of sass and I love it! I love it more than Riot!
This vinyl was supposed to be "black & white marble", but it just looked like any other black record.

I'm am going to begin by saying that before this album came out I actually didn't like Paramore. I just looked at them as another alternative rock band, and that there wasn't anything special about them. Since the release of "Now" I can now say that I am a fan of them. I love the fact that there is not one set genre that the entire album can be put into, it doesn't sound like the same boring thing over, and over, and over again. It's probably because I'm a fan of a lot of different genres, but it in general is just a great album. And I notice a lot of people complaining about lyrical depth with this album... listening to "I'm not angry anymore" should give you the hint that this album wasn't going to be about pure hate, or tension. The band built a bridge and got over it. Meaning there isn't going to be another track that has an anger sound to it like "Ignorance" for quite sometime until the band fights with each other or Chad and Hayley split (neither or going to happen for probably a real long time). This album is lighter because, when you let something go that was holding you down that's just how you feel. And about the album sounding nothing like the old Paramore, you can still hear it in there I think you really can on "Still into you". They never were a hardcore rock band and have released songs that were more poppy then many of the songs on this album.
This is not my type of music. I was listening to this group for the first time.
Not as good as their other cds. The music just isn't as catchy.

review_title: One of my favorites from Paramore!
review_text: This album is the saddest most upbeat thing Paramore has ever released and it's perfect.

I an so happy I bought this album the day it came out and I have listened to it so much.  I have loved Paramore since day one with all we know is falling but I was a little sad they aren't all rock now. but what eves I'm cool with it.  Paramore Forever!!!  I hope they get nominated for a award again.
Reminds me of classic 80s rock & roll...Yes!
The music is so different yet stayed true to their original sound. Love this band! A little bit of country sound on I hate to see your heart break and rock and roll on now.

review_title: and it's all boring. Used to love this band
review_text: If you fall asleep while listening to the beginning of this album (which is entirely likely), and then you wake up near the end, you wouldn't realize it. Everything sounds the same, and it's all boring. Used to love this band, but this album is their worst (and yes, I know there have been member changes). It was a struggle getting through start to finish. Would not recommend.

review_title: It's an acceptable mix-up that won't hurt your ears at all
review_text: If you have their first 3 albums and liked them, pick this one up. There is still a distinct Paramore feel to the entire CD, the same that made me like the predecessors. What's changed is the sound. It feels less like you caught Hayley and the gang reading out of a journal and more like they've taken the time to prepare some poetry or short stories for you. Same source, different vibe. Also, there are funk and pop threads laced into the workings on several songs. In the end, it's an acceptable mix-up that won't hurt your ears at all. Just look at the band's history; how could we ever be surprised that they decided to try to be different this time around? And, if you're like me, you'll be a little anxious to see where they go from here. Or was that review a bit Paramore than you were expecting?

I think Paramore did an awesome job in this album: good lyrics, good sounds and everyone's saying that they changed. Yes, they did. They're now three and wanted to do what they like. This is what they are; this is Paramore.

I have to admit that I thought Paramore spark was gone when the Farros left, I mean a genius guitarist like Josh and a bad ass drummer like Zac, it was just a big let down for me. I knew Taylor was a blessing coming into the band the time he did. He is also skillful at writing music and it shown in this album. I didnt like much of paramores single club singles but Monster was good potential, this album is amazing.Future , the last track has so much emotions in it when you hear Hayley singing so lightly and soft and this heavy guitar and instruments sweeps in and I picture Hayley head banging to the drum, all there struggles and happy moments, i can feel it in the music. Im proud to say paramore has made it though the Farros leaving. Good album, every dong is great

I must say I enjoyed every single song on this album. When I heard samples I knew I had to have it and I absolutely love it. My favorite song is Future because the guitar solo is the best thing ever, but every song is just as amazing. Definitely worth the buy.

It love this album. It started when I heard "Still into you" on my 4am commute to work. I had to "shazam" it to get the song/album info because it was immediately my favorite song and that's how the album has been for me, its all I listen to now. I love it.

Yay . It is exactly what I thought it would be . I think it has everything I like : The sound of retro classics and some rock to it it also has that bouncy sound that I like , like : ain't,it fun . So I am pleased with this album :-D
I personally don't think this album is just WOW! but there are some pretty good songs on here. I'm anxious for there next single/album.
Without a doubt their best album. Hayley's voice is very powerful. Make sure to listen to guitar and drums, very creative, great composition. They just keep getting better and better.
Different sound and I love it.

review_title: One of the finest bands gives us real music
review_text: It has been a long and anticipated wait but it is here and now I will review it honestly.1. Fast In My Car - A good melody and awesome chorus but not would have been my choice as an opener. The song is a different hear than any other album. It's a little No Doubt type. You will think it's weird at first but when you hear it again, you'll get addicted. 8.5/102. Now - The first single from the record. Hayley's best vocals on the record in my opinion. The song is really strong and it is pretty catchy. When I first heard it, it was very weird to me but then I got used to the new style as stated above. The bridge is also awesome. 9.5/103. Grow Up - My personal second favorite on the album. The lyrics and melody are so strong...it's unbelievable. I just think it's one of their songs. 10/104. Daydreaming - This song sounds like a Brand New Eyes song. That itself isn't a bad thing. It is not a bad song...it is actually pretty relaxing. Just not a personal favorite. 8/105. Interlude: Moving On - One of the first ukulele interludes on this record. It is pretty decent...besides it's not a "real" song so no rating is needed.6. Ain't It Fun - It is a really good song. It sounds like an R&B song and that is proof that Paramore is a diverse band. 9/107. Part II - My favorite song. It has a part of Conspiracy (All We Know Is Falling) but it is a part to Let The Flames Begin. It is really creative. I love Let The Flames Begin and now there is a part 2!!! 10/108. Lost Hope - An uplifting song. It has a harmonica in it. It is OK...doesn't really stand out much....7.5/109. Still Into You - 3rd favorite song. This is a really addicting song...I've listened to this like 10 times when I heard first. I like the song...the melody is really pretty and it was an awesome pick for 2nd single. It sounds like Paramore. 10/1010. Anklebiters - A punk rock song. Sounds like a Riot! song. The song is really creative. The problem is it is short..9/1011. Interlude: Holiday - 2nd Interlude...I actually like this one better than the other though...12. Proof - This song isn't really a stand out or not really an honorable mention. It is kinda just on the record, lyrics don't really stand out but it is still good...not the best though....7.5/1013. Hate To See Your Heart Break - The song is beautiful but not a favorite at all...like the lyrics though...7.5/1014. (One Of Those) Crazy Girls - The song isn't all that either....It is ok....7.5/1015. Interlude: I'm Not Angry Anymore - Last Interlude....it is ok...16. Be Alone - This album picks up the energy with is kicky song. This is vintage Paramore. Sounds like another Brand New Eyes left over but this song is really energetic and I really like it. 9/1017. Future - This is the slowest and longest song on the record. It starts off really soft but then there comes this great emotional instrumental solo. That's how this song is....It is an amazing closer song....The song kinda sound grunge type to me...9/10Overall, this album proves a lot of people wrong who say that Paramore sticks to the same script. It has tons of variety and and be a listen for everyone, R&B, Country, Alternative, Rock, Pop; etc. It is a great addition to the Paramore library and I can't wait for what else is in store.Many people are worried about the change. Don't be. It doesn't change their formula by a lot. Every song had it's place on the album and the change is not as apparent as Linkin Park. The instruments are not as punk rock but more alternative rock but that is the only different. Buy it Paramore fans and for that matter....buy it music fansP.S. This album does lack in the area of awesome guitar riffs....It is alternative so don't get upset at the guitar work that much...I believe they could have been harder though
Great album. First listen was OK, but then I couldnt shut it off. Very different sound and feel. But it works!
maybe this is not as good as 'brand new eyes' but they still do great songs, i'm loving it so far!
an underrated album. good cd overall but can be better.
awesome album... still themselves but able to make a new sound.  you can hear how evolved Haley vocal ability has become.
Best album yet by this band and the best record of the year in my opinion! Go buy it and check it out if you haven't already done so
Great album by a perfect band! I never leaves the CD playing in my car!
Perfect. I love Paramore and this is different from their regular music taste. But it's a good change.  Recommend to anyone&everyone.
This album was a great comeback for Paramore. They explored different sounds and were able to display true artistic skill.
Love Paramore! They do not disappoint with this album! I love "Ain't it Fun" and "Grow Up"! My new favorite album!
Record is ok but the the cover is bent
Call them the new Paramore, but I love them all the same. This was an awesome album. It has some of my favorite Paramore songs. Definitely worth the money! :)

review_title: New Paramore Album is full of new sounds.
review_text: I have been a long time Paramore fan... I'm talking back when "Pressure" premiered on FUSE. Thus, I feel like I can honestly give advice on this album in comparison to their previous ones... And this is definitely not the same ole Paramore. However, they have been changing for quite some time... Their first album was gritty rock. Their second was gritty pop. Their third sort of went back to the feel of their first album, but was definitely more mainstream. This album is the biggest departure in style between albums for them, but, like I said, they have been evolving for a while.Even though this isn't what you'd expect from Paramore, I absolutely loved it.This album is full of sounds I have never heard before, and, although the styles vary on this album, everything ends up being cohesive. (They really took a risk doing all of these styles because it very easily could have been a big, fat mess.)I do have to say though, Hayley doesn't have as many WOW moments on this album, but you can hear the versatility in her voice- something we haven't heard much of before. Even though I would have liked to hear her really push her voice in this way, she definitely DOES push it by changing up her tone and delivery.To make a long review short, I honestly like every song- something that is VERY rare for me. I even like the interludes, which I admit, I was skeptical about at first...as interludes are usually a waste of space. These interludes; however, are there for a purpose, and they bring out a different side to her voice.The standout tracks on this album for me are: Fast in my Car, Daydreaming, Ain't it Fun, Part II, Last Hope, Hate to See Your Heart Break, Proof, and Be Alone (sounds like "old school" Paramore.)Best album of the year for me.
They try to look like punks, they try to match the image and attitude perfectly.But if you actually listen to the music... It's as radio friendly and safe as Coldplay.
Great follow up.
I think my title says it all. What a awesome album. More pop than rock but it works for just the three of them.
Complete disapointment. Can I get my money back ? Oh yea I can't. I'm not a lyrical guy but I did notice they need to find better song writers.

I have been a Paramore fan for years and this is in my opinion their best album to date. Yes, it has a different sound, but I think that is a good thing. This is an eclectic album. There is some Pop, Gospel and of course Rock sounds in this album. My favorite tracks are Fast in My Car, Now, Daydreaming, Grow Up, Still Into You and Ain't it fun. I love every song on the album but, those are my favorites. There is not one song I want to skip while I listen to it. (The interludes are also great.)

review_title: Without Josh and Zac, Paramore drifts into mediocrity
review_text: Well, upon hearing that Paramore had lost the Farro brothers from the lineup, I was interested to see what they would do next.  I thought it was interesting that they decided to go on without them, with a trimmed-down lineup, and would release new music under that lineup.  With the song "Monster", I found that Paramore still had some essence to them, but it was disappointing in comparison to their past music.  I was hoping that, on the next album, they would do better than this.Unfortunately, that has not happened.  They have instead gone backwards, replacing the lyrics and attitude of their previous efforts with electronics and production to the point where only Hayley's voice is distinguishable.  Josh and Zac were crucial to the band, and this effort clearly demonstrates what happens when they lose such crucial members from the lineup.  Without their musicianship and lyricism, this album is greatly harmed.  The edgy, pop-punk/alternative rock style characteristic of Paramore's previous three efforts is virtually wiped out on this album, replacing it with a watered-down, simplistic powerpop sound that fails to truly do the band, and Hayley Williams' voice, justice.  In short, this album feels more like a Katy Perry or Avril Lavigne effort, rather than a true Paramore effort.As for the tracks, the production is shiny, but as a whole, nearly all of them feel lifeless and hollow (though the songs "Now" and "Still Into You" admittedly can be earworms).  The song "Part II" is the only song that actually FEELS like a true Paramore song on this album, and "Still Into You" and "Be Alone" show significant elements of Paramore's trademark style, but other than these tracks, the rest of the album is forgettable and shallow.  Perhaps if Paramore would have built upon "Part II", "Be Alone", and "Monster" (and to a certain degree "Still Into You"), they might have been better able to negate the lineup change.In closing, the loss of Zac and Josh Farro from the band has proven to be devastating to the band, and without their contributions, Paramore has taken a turn for the worse.  Here's to hoping any future albums correct the mistakes made on this effort.

Unlike other reviewers. I do not find this to be their best sounding album.It is their first album that I have not outright bought...nor do I have any interest in buying it at all.Track by Track:1.Fast in my car-Beginning instrumental sounds to techno but gradually works up to kind of rock-ish.Good for rocking out in the car.Sounds overall like ye olden days of rock-at least what they're trying for. Really sounds like Avril Lavigne-in her early pop days.Too repetitive.2.Now-WORST song on the album-in my opinion.Granted the preview clip of hayley singing Now-ow-ow-ow was enough to rouse fans to excitement. BUT overall the song sound far too much like dubstep to even be considered likable-at least to me.3. Grow up-Not typical Paramore but still likable.Once again overly repetitive.But for me personally...I could try getting used to it.BUT not an immediate favorite.Too Slow...I'm at 1:55 and struggling to keep my eyes open. Then again maybe I won't try this one on my ipod.4.Daydreaming-Starts out too slow-my opinion.Sounds too much like "Grow up"same type of slow beginning,same beat.5.Interlude:Moving on-Not caring for their Hawaiian beat in this. Short song. A shot at the Farrow brothers.Very Obviously so.Shame.Hayley you are very much not over it then,huh?6.Ain't it fun-80s beat.Don't mind it.Kinda like the retro thing its got going.I can give this a test on my Ipod/Itunes.7.Part 2-You know how Hayley was being all cryptic in the 4 nights,4 sides thing. Its part 2 of "Let the Flames begin". I am inclined to like it because part 1 could easily be called on of my favorite songs on AWKIF.But at the same time I'm wondering "were they running out of ideas and the album said write another one NOW". Its like finding out your favorite Disney movie is having a sequel forced upon it. Torn.Like it but don't like the idea of it.8.Last Hope-Another depressing sounding song.Repetitive. Putting me to sleep.9.Still Into You-I know many fans...did not like hearing this as the second single off this album.I am not one of them. Its a happy song. I like the happy,lovey dovey song.I really do. It sounds like the Paramore we know and love. I love how its cheeky like "That's What You Get". I just like it.10.Anklebiters-Sounds like PARAMORE. Rather than paramore.Rocking out while listening to this.Good message too. You shouldn't care what EVERYBODY thinks.Shortest song on the album. That ISN'T an interlude.11.Interlude:Holiday-Too island-y again. Though, at least...I know someone who can play this on ukelele if they want. Seems simple enough.12.Proof-They're BAAAAAAAAAACK. Well sort of. Another love song.13.Hate to see your heart break-Sad song.slow song.14.(One Of Those)Crazy Girls-Listened to the preview on Itunes....liked it. Listened to the full version...WTF???!!! Is that even Hayley singing. Or is the GUEST singer. More than just another guest singer. Are you guys auditioning a new female vocalist?15.Interlude: I'm not angry anymore- Did you guys record half this album in Hawaii or something??? This is getting old.16.Be Alone-Sexual innuendo song. Why would she wanna hang out with her friends??? When she could BE ALONE with you ;)Too repetitive.17.Future-Semi-boring.slow song.Sorry about the lack of review content for 13 & 14. I'm listening on Youtube and WMG is starting to take all of the lyrics videos down.Probably trying to force us to buy the CD.I'm not a fair-weather fan if I don't love every song they put out. I'm sorry but people saying that is rather disrespectful. We're still fans,too.
I only like "Hard Times" so here's a star for that song.

review_title: Not my kind of music, not ever, but ...
review_text: Not my kind of music, not ever, but I do respect and try to support young artists. Here is the rub: I never ordered this from Amazon, and never would, but somehow I got this blasting on my phone, and was charged $4 for it.  I tried to resolve the situation with King Bezos and his crew of pivates, to no avail.

Ok, don't get me wrong, I usually REALLY like Paramore's music.... but their new album is EXTREMELY lackluster. They went from "uniquely beautiful and intense" to "trendy, repetitive, bubblegum nonsense". It's like you can almost hear the ringing sound of the band members cashing checks over the total of the 3 chords they play in every song on the album.Honestly, based on ALL of Paramore's previous albums, I REALLY expected more than what we're getting here.

review_title: This is NOT an mp3 download as advertised.
review_text: This is NOT an mp3 download as advertised. It is itunes format and will not work for your mp3 player

I have been a HUGE Paramore fan for years now. Rarely is there a Paramore song that I don't like or can't at least listen to. When I heard about this album I was so freaking excited because they haven't put out any new music in years. I thought about all the amazing new songs I could add to my collection. When I started listening to this album, I found myself skipping song after song, waiting to get to one that would be a hit for me...but that moment NEVER came. I can think of so many amazing songs from their past they've done like "I Caught Myself" and "My Heart", none of which on this album even come close to touching. There are no really good songs on here in my opinion. I didn't find one single song I actually enjoyed trying to sit through entirely. They have changed their sound/music style. I know that artists want to progress and grow but this feels like regression for them. They were already at the height of their game in the past, so I expected this album to be phenomenal but it was totally disappointing. I am really bummed out about this. Oh well, guess I'll back to listening to the OLD Paramore.

review_title: Haley's voice is still beautiful. as always
review_text: Haley's voice is still beautiful.as always.  As far as the new sound is concerned, the band has really mellowed out in their old age.  Several of these songs would've sounded better as rock songs.  I'll stick with listening to their previous albums.

It has an awesome 80's vibe. Paramore did it again, putting a quality album out.Music is very catchy, and my daughter loves dancing to hard times.We have the hard copy as well as a digital copy.My wife loves all the songs, i on the other don't like maybe 1 or 2. But still wouldn't not want the album.
Am a big fan of Paramore, so I love all of their music.  Although, I'd prefer their past albums, this one is more pop. Can't wait for their concert!

Amazing album as always, praying for a new Paramore album soon. The record works well and doesn't skip or anything, the audio is pretty clear as well. My only issue is that the songs play a bit faster and higher-pitched than they probably should..? Which I'm pretty sure isn't just an issue with my turn table because I put one of their other albums, Riot, on before and the songs off of that album sounded just fine. It isn't really that noticeable though.

Taken completely out of context of the rest of the band's music, After Laughter is good stuff. I'm into the 80s throwback sound a lot of bands are using, so this album's flavor works for me. Paramore's always had a pessimistic outlook, which makes for some satisfying sad person music, and luckily that hasn't changed here, making the album have this awesome contrast of downer lyrics meshing with snappy, bouncy 80s pop production. The band fits pretty naturally into the sound, honestly, and the weird (possibly studio calculated) sound change isn't depressing because the band's soul still feels intact, lyrically and tonally.Taken in the context of the rest of Paramore's music, I have a hard time not being disappointed with a throwback, alt-rock infused pop album after getting such a ripping (and considerably more mature) rock album with their self-titled from 2013. There's nothing close to a Part III on After Laughter - even Still Into You has a little more of a bite to it than most everything on here. But let's not overthink it. Rose Colored Boy, Fake Happy, and pretty much every other one of these tight, sweet songs are pretty killer jams. And underneath the bubble gum veneer, Paramore's soul still lives in its lyrics.Fun album that I'm still enjoying a couple months in, but I am hoping they give their next one more growl and kick, if we're lucky enough to get another.

I really like all the singles they put out and their new sound. I do still love traditional Paramore but this was fun 80's pop and I really enjoyed it. It is very upbeat and nice to hear the joy and happiness in their music on this album. Some songs that did not make it to radio are pretty good as well . Last Hope and Future are 2 of my favorite listens from this album. Hope you enjoy it as much as I am.

It's  really relatable to someone that has or is struggling with something like depression.The sound is different than previous records which is probably gonna make some old fans not like the album but there is still the rock sound and the pop rock sound goes well together it's actually more fitting sound since the band went with a colorful look for this album but the songs still have deep meanings and fantastic lyrics could even make you cry a little.One song is a little weird which is no friend Its my least favorite song it's an outtro I'm not a big fan of songs that go together but are two tracks.

Never been prouder of this band. Yes it's different and people don't like different but I love this different. Paramore has always evolved from album to album. I've grown up on there music and as an adult I have so much respect this this price of work. 26 made me ball my eyes out and Caught In The Middle just makes me want to dance. Can we talk about No Friends like Geez! Paramore can come out with a country album and that would be fire. And I don't even do country like that. Any old fan new fan no fan whatever it's a brilliant album.
